original_title: Shell en de olieramp in Nigeria
overview: Shell has been active in Nigeria for decades and this activity has caused enormous environmental damage in Nigeria.  Shell's actions in Nigeria have led to resistance for many years, including among the local population, but there are also groups in the Netherlands that oppose Shell's activities in Nigeria. For example, this year after a 13-year trial, the company was ordered to pay damages to a group of Nigerian farmers, an unprecedented legal precedent. In this documentary of VICE's long-running series Toxic, we tell the story of this lawsuit through the eyes of human rights lawyer Channa Samkalden.  This documentary was made in collaboration with The Council for Environmental Defence
title: Shell and the oil spill disaster in Nigeria
